resources.string: Select optional strategies that would you like to include in your sleep plan (hold selection for more info):
Receive reminder notifications to take melatonin at the most effective time for sleep cycle adjustment.
[Smartwatch required] Monitor your environmental light intensity and control your light exposure to adjust your body\'s internal circadian rhythm.

Melatonin is a natural hormone that the body produces to induce sleep. Melatonin is produced when it is dark, and melatonin production is directly inhibited by light. Thus, users who need to sleep earlier than they are used to may find taking melatonin to be helpful in helping them fall asleep when they need to. As a result, studies have shown that melatonin has been especially effective in helping prevent jet lag in this way.

Whether our bodies\' natural circadian rhythms align with the environment are determined by several factors, with one of the most important ones being light. Bright light exposure can cause a \'phase shift\', an advance or delay in circadian rhythms. Thus, by carefully controlling our exposure to light, we can use phase shifting to match our circadian rhythms to our destination\'s time zone, preventing jet lag.

The top horizontal axis represents time in your set origin, while the bottom horizontal axis represents time in your destination. Your target sleep period is outlined in yellow, while your sleep period for the night is outlined in blue. The periodic curve approximates the daylight cycle of your destination, with the darker sections of the curve representing sundown periods.
